document.id: Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians Res. No. 1042-03-24
document.heading: Resolution Number TMBC1042-03-24 of the Duly Elected and Certified Governing Body of the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa

citations.citation: Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians Res. No. 1042-03-24

recital.text: the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians, hereinafter referred to as the Tribe, is an unincorporated Band acting under a revised Constitution and By-Laws approved by the Secretary of the Interior on June 16th, 1959 and amendments thereto approved; and

Article IX (a) Section 1 of the Turtle Mountain Constitution and By-Laws empowers the Tribal Council with the authority to represent the Band and to negotiate with Federal, State, and Local Governments and with private persons; and

Article IX (a) Section 1 of the Turtle Mountain Constitution and Bylaws requires a 30-day comment period prior to the adoption of any ordinances or amendments to the Tribal Code, whether proposed by resolution or otherwise. Adoption must occur through a roll call vote of the Tribal Council at a publicly held meeting; and

the Tribe is proposing revisions to Title 5 Children's Code, Chapter 5.02 Section 5.02.050 Summons; Content and Service Thereof to add language for the process server to be at least 18 years of age and not a party to nor interested in the action with a strikethrough of as appointed by the Court; and
the Tribe approves a 30-day comment period for the proposed amendments to Title 5, Chapter 5.02 Section 5.02.050 Summons; Content and Service Thereof; now
that the Tribe is approving a 30-day comment period for the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians Title 5, Chapter 5.02 Section 5.02.050 proposed amendments.

procedural-data.text: I, the undersigned Tribal Secretary of the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians, do hereby certify that the Tribal Council is composed of nine (9) members of whom six (6) constituting a quorum were present at a meeting duly called, convened and held on the 7th day of March, 2024 that the foregoing resolution was adopted by an affirmative vote of five (5) in favor- Representatives Lynn Gourneau, Jon Jon Keplin, Elmer Davis Jr., Kenneth Malaterre and Chad Counts; three (3) absent- Reps. Blaine "Slugger" Davis, Ron Trottier Sr. and Craig Lunday; none (0) opposed- Rep. with the Chairman not voting.
